results.title: The Time to Live and the Time to Die = Tong Nien Wang Shi
results.creator_credit: Xiaoxian Hou and Central Motion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: The Time to Live and the Time to Die is the story of a boy in the early 1950’s, baffled by all the grown-up’s talk of “home” on the mainland, unmoved by the portentous news stories that come over the radio; the story of a teenage delinquent in the early 1960s, thrown out of school, getting into fights with rival gangs, feeling the first stirring’s of sexual curiosity. It is Hou’s own voice that speaks the narration at the beginnings and end, confirming the intimacy and the candour of these memories. But this is also the story of a generation, the generation that fled from the hardships of China in the late 1940s, settled in the comparative prosperity of Taiwan and then found itself unable to return. It’s a story never before told on film, and certainly never visualised in such piercing and accurate detail. This has nothing to do with nostalgia. It is founded on a warm but clear-eyed sensitivity to the ways that people talk, think and behave. The result is one of the greatest Chinese films ever made.

results.title: Midnite spares
results.creator_credit: Quentin Masters, Tom Burstall and Filmco
results.brief_description: A group of criminals strip cars for their parts and are involved in a kidnapping. When the man’s son returns home after a long absence, he embarks on a chaotic rescue mission with the help of a few friends. Stars James Laurie, Gia Carides, Max Cullen and Bruce Spence.

results.title: Mad Max: beyond thunderdome
results.creator_credit: George Miller, George Ogilvie, Byron Kennedy and Kennedy Miller Productions
results.brief_description: Mad Max continues as the hero who stands alone against barbarians of a post-nuclear age. The action is set in Bartertown, where Max arrives in search of some stolen property and has to fight a duel in the Thunderdome arena. Mel Gibson is joined by Tina Turner in the third Mad Max film. Cast also includes Helen Buday, Frank Thring, Bruce Spence, Robert Grubb, Angry Anderson.

results.title: Crosstalk
results.creator_credit: Mark Egerton, Errol Sullivan, Filmside Productions and Wall to Wall
results.brief_description: A computer expert crippled in a suspicious accident is now confined to a flat with a nurse. He was originally investigating the malfunctioning of a super computer but now finds himself menaced by the same technology.

results.title: Smoke 'em if you got 'em
results.brief_description: In smouldering post-nuclear devastation, a periscope protruding from the rubble leads to an underground fall-out shelter where a party is raging in celebration of the big meltdown and will continue until the end of the world as we know it. Irreverent, bizarre comedy, starring Nique Needles and Rob Howard.

results.title: Wills and Burke: The Untold Story
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Margot McDonald and Stony Desert
results.brief_description: Comic recreation of explorers Burke & Wills and their ill-fated expedition to cross Australia in 1860. Setting out with 28 camels and 4 camel drivers, they were two-thirds through the journey when the expedition was completely without food and almost out of tea. Public enthusiasm remained high for Burke & Wills and the expedition from which they did not return. Starring Gary McDonald and Kim Gyngell.

results.title: The Wild Duck
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Phillip Emanuel and Film Bancor of Aust
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Henrik Ibsen about the fortunes of a loving family - the ineffectual loving father whose pride and dreams conceal a life of poverty and failure, his practical wife and their beautiful and faithful young daughter. The family is broken apart when deceived by the misplaced idealism of another person. Stars Liv Ullman and Jeremy Irons.

results.title: Dogs in Space
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Jill Bilcock, Glenys Rowe, Burrowes Film Group and Entertainment Media
results.brief_description: Young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation.

constellations_other.name: Black Power through film and TV
constellations_other.description: The Black Power movement of the late 1960s and early 70s was “the most exciting and dynamic era in modern Indigenous history” according to Aboriginal activist Professor Gary Foley, who gained widespread attention for protests during the time and later leveraged film and TV to fight for Indigenous rights.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Lowenstein, Jill Bilcock, Glenys Rowe, Burrowes Film Group and Entertainment Media
results.description: A group of young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation living on sex, drugs, rock ‘n’ roll and television. Stars Michael Hutchence of INXS.

results.title: Norman Loves Rose
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Basil Appleby, Direct Hit Productions and Norman Films
results.brief_description: Norman is a sensitive, precocious 13 year old preparing for his formal entry into Jewish manhood, the bar mitzvah. He is also passionately in love with his sister-in-law, Rose, who is pregnant. Stars Carol Kane, Tony Owen with Barry Otto, Sandy Gore and Warren Mitchell.

results.title: Asya's Happiness
results.brief_description: Asya Klyashina is a cook in a small Russian village, lame and unmarried. During harvest time she works at a field camp where she renews acquaintance with Sasha, a driver returned from the city, who announces that he loves her but has no thought of marriage. Mothers look after their children amid the harvest; the men reminisce about the Patriotic War (“fighting for the Motherland, for Stalin”) and about the prison camps after the war. But complications to her life start when Asya discovers she is pregnant by another youth, Stephan.
